entry.title: Hands-on with AWS Bring your own IP addresses (BYOIP) in Amazon EC2
entry.summary: Using AWS Bring your own IP addresses (BYOIP) in Amazon EC2 capability with a real life example of an IPv6 prefix, showing provisioning and troubleshooting steps.
entry.content: This blog post will walk you through the Bring your own IP addresses (BYOIP) for Amazon EC2, using a real-life example. With BYOIP you can bring part or all of your publicly routable IPv4 or IPv6 address ranges to your AWS account. While you continue to own the address range, AWS advertises it on the internet for you under the Amazon Autonomous System Numbers (ASNs). entry.title: AWS Direct Connect overview
entry.summary: Overview of AWS Direct Connect, with which you can establish private connectivity between AWS and your data center, office, factory or collocated environment.
entry.content: AWS Direct Connect (DX) makes it easy to establish a dedicated connection from an on-premises network to AWS. Using AWS Direct Connect, you can establish private connectivity between AWS and your data center, office, factory or collocated environment. Such connectivity can reduce network costs, increase bandwidth, and provide a more consistent network experience than internet-based connections. entry.summary: How to setup the AWS Site-to-Site VPN (IPSec) with IPv6
entry.content: Recently AWS released support for IPv6 traffic over the AWS Site-to-Site VPN (IPSec).
